Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a picture of a healthy plant with enough sunlight and water, clearly showing bright leaves and strong stems.
The student can depict a plant without sunlight and show some effects, such as wilted stems or pale leaves, indicating an understanding that sunlight is needed.
The student can draw a plant without water and illustrate drying effects, like drooped leaves or brown edges, demonstrating awareness of water's importance.
The student can illustrate the general idea that plants need both water and light to live and grow, perhaps showing sunlight and raindrops in the drawing.
The student can identify patterns by showing visual differences between healthy and unhealthy plants, such as color contrast or structural changes.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently label parts of the plant correctly, occasionally forgetting to label sunlight or water sources (incomplete labeling).
The student might show minor gaps by not fully illustrating how water affects different parts of the plant beyond just color changes (partial understanding of water's role).
